dt: {bc}to assail vigorously or persistently (as with questions)
{bc}to subject to the impact of rapidly moving particles (such as electrons)

pt: {sc}attack{/sc} {sc}assail{/sc} {sc}assault{/sc} {sc}bombard{/sc} {sc}storm{/sc} mean to make an onslaught upon. {sc}attack{/sc} implies taking the initiative in a struggle.

pt.t: plan to {it}attack{/it} the town at dawn

pt: {sc}assail{/sc} implies attempting to break down resistance by repeated blows or shots.
{sc}assault{/sc} suggests a direct attempt to overpower by suddenness and violence of onslaught.

pt.t: commandos {it}assaulted{/it} the building from all sides

pt: {sc}bombard{/sc} applies to attacking with bombs or shells.
{sc}storm{/sc} implies attempting to break into a defended position.

et: earlier, "to fire a large cannon," borrowed from Middle French {it}bombarder,{/it} verbal derivative of {it}bombarde{/it} {et_link|bombard:1|bombard:1}
shortdef: to attack especially with artillery or bombers
to assail vigorously or persistently (as with questions)
to subject to the impact of rapidly moving particles (such as electrons)
